game

Class HumanCorpse

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
      • game.PortableItem
        • game.HumanCorpse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ItemInterface

    public class HumanCorpse
extends PortableItem
    Represents the human corpse in the Zombie game world. Human corpse will revive as Zombie after 5 - 10 turns since the Human dies.
    Author:
    Kee Pei Jiin

    • Field Detail

      • turn

        private int turn
        Keeps track of the number of turns since the human corpse has been created

      • revive_turn

        private int revive_turn
        Stores the number of turns required for human corpse to revive. This value differs for each HumanCorpse

      • MIN_TURN

        private static final int MIN_TURN
        Constant that stores the minimum number of turns needed for human corpse to revive

    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanCorpse

        protected HumanCorpse(java.lang.String deadHumanName)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        deadHumanName - The name of the dead human, will be used as the name of the Zombie when the HumanCorpse revives

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location location)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        HumanCorpse can experience the passage of time when it is on the Ground. When the number of turns since human corpse was created reaches revive_turn, it will revives as a Zombie at the nearest location that does not have an Actor.
        Overrides:
        tick in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the HumanCorpse
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location argument is null

      • tick

        public void tick(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location location,
                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor actor)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        HumanCorpse can experience the passage of time when it is in an Actor's inventory. When the number of turns since human corpse was created reaches revive_turn, it will revives as a Zombie at the nearest location that does not have an Actor.
        Overrides:
        tick in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the HumanCorpse
        actor - The actor that is carrying this human corpse
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if location or actor argument is null

      • revive

        private void revive(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location corpseLoc)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new Zombie and adds it at the nearest location that can be entered by an Actor. The Zombie can enter a location is the location is passable and does not contain another actor.
        Parameters:
        corpseLoc - The location of the HumanCorpse
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if corpseLoc is null
